createdFrom.description: User id of admin who created the encryption entry

usage.description: Map containing information about usage of this encryption

data.description: Data for password source. If type is ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE then it is the the name of the environment variable.

type.description: Type of password source. Can be [NONE, ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE]

name.description: Name of the domain which will provide this encryption data elements

type.description: The type description of the json content

configurations.description: Configurations can be linked at creation time as well - see update description

description.description: A short description for the profile

projectIds.description: Projects can be linked by their ids at creation time as well - see update description

enabled.description: Enabled state of profile, default is false

description.description: A short description for the profile

projectIds.description: Projects can be linked by their ids here

enabled.description: Enabled state of profile, default is false

uuid.description: Add uuid for configuration to use here

description.description: A short description for the profile

enabled.description: Enabled state of profile, default is false

password.description: Password, either plain (not recommended) or with env:VARIABLENAME, in last case the password will be from environment variable

user.description: User name, either plain (not recommended) or with env:VARIABLENAME, in last case the user name will be from environment variable

enabled.description: Enabled state of executor, per default false

password.description: Password, either plain (not recommended) or with env:VARIABLENAME, in last case the password will be from environment variable

user.description: User name, either plain (not recommended) or with env:VARIABLENAME, in last case the user name will be from environment variable

projectData.description: Project data list containing false positive setup for the project

cweId.description: Defines a CWE ID for false positives which occur during webscans. This is mandatory, but can be empty. If it is not specified it matches the findings with no CWE IDs.

methods.description: Defines a list of (HTTP) methods for false positives which occur during webscans. This is optional and if nothing is specified, the entry applies to all methods.

urlPattern.description: Defines a url pattern for false positives which occur during webscans. Can be used with wildcards like '*.host.com'. Each entry must contain more than just wildcards, '*.*.*' or '*' are not allowed.

webScan.description: Defines a section for false positives which occur during webscans.

comment.description: A comment describing why this is a false positive.

id.description: Identifier which is used to update or remove the respective false positive entry.

apiVersion.description: The api version, currently only 1.0 is supported

jobData.description: Job data list containing false positive setup based on former jobs

jobUUID.description: SecHub job uuid where finding was

findingId.description: SecHub finding identifier - identifies problem inside the job which shall be markeda as a false positive.

comment.description: A comment describing why this is a false positive

type.description: The type of the json content. Currently only accepted value is 'falsePositiveDataList' but we also still accept the deprecated type 'falsePositiveJobDataList'.

trafficLight.description: Trafficlight of job - but only available when job has been done. Possible states are GREEN, YELLOW, RED, OFF

type.description: Always `executorProfileList` as an identifier for the list
Always `executorConfigurationList` as an identifier for the list

owner.description: Owner of the job - means user which triggered it

jobUUID.description: The uuid of the running job

projectId.description: The name of the project the job is running for

since.description: Timestamp since when job has been started

owner.description: Username of the owner of this project. An owner is the person in charge

metaData.description: An JSON object containing metadata key-value pairs defined for this project

apiVersion.description: The api version, currently only 1.0 is supported

name.description: Name of the project to create. Is also used as a unique ID!

uris.description: All URIs used now for whitelisting. Former parts will be replaced completely!

owner.description: Username of the owner of this project. An owner is the person in charge.

metaData.description: An JSON object containing metadata key-value pairs defined for this project.

templateIds.description: A list of all templates assigned to the project

whiteList.description: A list of all whitelisted URIs. Only these ones can be scanned for the project!

users.description: A list of all users having access to the project

*.description: Meta data of job - but only contained in result, when query parameter `withMetaData` is defined as 'true'.

trafficLight.description: Trafficlight of job - but only available when job has been done. Possible states are GREEN, YELLOW, RED, OFF

apiVersion.description: The api version, currently only 1.0 is supported

ProjectScanLogs.title: ProjectScanLogs
ProjectScanLogs.description: An array of scan log summary entries

executedBy.description: The user id of the user which executed the scan

sechubJobUUID.description: The uuid of corresponding sechub Job.

ended.description: The timestamp when the scan was ended

started.description: The timestamp when the scan was started

status.description: A status field about scan situation

items.description: An array of scan log summary entries

apiVersion.description: The api version, currently only 1.0 is supported

uris.description: All URIS used now for whitelisting. Former parts will be replaced completely!

apiVersion.description: The api version, currently only 1.0 is supported

folders.description: Sources from given file system folders

files.description: Sources from given file system files

folders.description: Binaries from given file system folders

files.description: Binaries from given file system files

use.description: Referenced data configuration objects by their unique names
Referenced data configuration objects by their unique names

folders.description: Code scan sources from given file system folders

files.description: Code scan sources from given file system files

use.description: Referenced data configuration objects by their unique names

headers.description: List of HTTP headers. Can be used for authentication or anything else.

onlyForUrls.description: Optional list of URLs this header shall be used for like: https://mywebapp.com/path/. Can contain wildcards like: https://mywebapp.com/path/<*>/with/wildcard

use.description: Reference to the data section containing a file with the value for this header, e.g if the value is to big for the sechub configuration. Always use 'sources' with a single 'file' instead 'folders'.

name.description: Name of the defined HTTP header.

sensitive.description: Defines header masking. If 'true' the header value will be replaced with '********' inside the report, 'false' will show the value as is. Default is set to 'true'.

value.description: Value of the defined HTTP header. Either specify the header value directly here or reference a data section with 'use' e.g. if the value is to big, but never specify both.

duration.description: Duration of the scan as integer

unit.description: Unit of the duration. Possible values are: millisecond(s), second(s), minute(s), hour(s), day(s)

password.description: Password the client certificate file is protected with

use.description: Reference to the data section containing the client certificate definition file. Always use 'sources' with a single 'file' instead 'folders'.

xpath.description: xpathto locate the element to avoid on the frontend.

htmlElement.description: 'htmlElement' to locate the element to avoid on the frontend.

logout.description: Webscan 'logout' section to avoid logout for webscans of a frontend.

excludes.description: Exclude URL sub-paths to scan. Example: /admin

includes.description: Include URL sub-paths to scan. Example: /hidden

apiDefinitionUrl.description: Specifies an URL to read the API definition from.

use.description: Reference to the data section containing the API definition files. Always use 'sources' with 'files' instead 'folders'.

type.description: Type of the API definition files that will be provided

seed.description: The seed/secret for the TOTP generation. If TOTP is configured this parameter is mandatory.

tokenLength.description: The length of the generated TOTP. In most cases nothing is specified and the default length '6' is used.

encodingType.description: The encoding type of the 'seed'. The default value is 'AUTODETECT'. Currently available values are: 'BASE64', 'BASE32', 'HEX', 'PLAIN', 'AUTODETECT'

hashAlgorithm.description: The hash algorithm to generate the TOTP. In most cases nothing is specified and the  default hash algorithm 'HMAC_SHA1' is used. Currently available values are: 'HMAC_SHA1', 'HMAC_SHA256', 'HMAC_SHA512'

validityInSeconds.description: The time in seconds the generated TOTP is valid. In most cases nothing is specified and the default of '30' seconds is used.

totp.description: Optional TOTP configuration as an additional authentication factor.

unit.description: the time unit to wait: millisecond, second, minute, hour, day.

type.description: action type: username, password, input, click, wait

optional.description: Defines if the variable is optional. The default is false

regularExpression.description: A regular expression which must match to accept the user input inside the variable

minLength.description: The minimum content length of this variable

maxLength.description: The maximum content length of this variable

assetId.description: The asset id used by the template

type.description: The template type. Must be be defined when a new template is created. An update will ignore changes of this property because the type is immutable! Currently supported types are: [Lcom.mercedesbenz.sechub.commons.model.template.TemplateType;@62418263

projects.description: The projects the user has access to

superAdmin.description: True, when this user is a super administrator

email.description: The email address of the user

ownedProjects.description: The projects the user is owner of

apiVersion.description: The api version, currently only 1.0 is supported

userId.description: Wanted userid, the userid must be lowercase only!

files.description: Array containing data about files from asset

api-admin-asset-ids519982223.description: Array contains all existing asset identifiers

optional.description: Defines if the variable is optional. The default is false

regularExpression.description: A regular expression which must match to accept the user input inside the variable

minLength.description: The minimum content length of this variable

maxLength.description: The maximum content length of this variable

assetId.description: The asset id used by the template

type.description: The template type. Currently supported types are: [Lcom.mercedesbenz.sechub.commons.model.template.TemplateType;@2f397395

api-admin-templates-753726831.description: Array contains all existing template identifiers

entries.description: A list of healthcheck status entries. Each entry represents a problem or an information.

executorConfigUUID.description: The uuid of the product executor config where the problem/info is related to (in combination with template)

fileName.description: The name of the file inside the asset

projects.description: A list of projects which have the template assigned

solution.description: A solution how to fix/resolve the problem

assetId.description: The asset identifier which is used to locate the file

hints.description: A list of hints which gives additinal information. E.g. A disabled executor configuration which leads to problems will lead to a WARNING, but not to an ERROR. In this case a hint 'At least one executor config is not enabled' would be added.

profiles.description: A list of the invovled profiles, means using executor config and being assigned to projects

description.description: A description about the the entry

templateId.description: The template id for the template where the problem/information is related to

type.description: Type of this entry. Can be one of : [INFO, WARNING, ERROR]

status.description: Represents overall healthcheck status. Can be one of : [OK, WARNING, ERROR]

enabledProfileIds.description: List of profile IDs assigned to the project.

isOwned.description: If caller is owner of the project

assignedUsers.description: Optional: Assigned users (only viewable by owner or admin)

post.summary: Admin disables job processing in scheduler
post.description: An administrator disables scheduler job processing. This can be a preparation for system wide update - when scheduling is stoped, user can ask for new SecHub Jobs etc. But as long as scheduler is stopped nothing is executed - so JVMs/PODs can be updated in cluster
An administrator starts scheduler job processing. This can be a necessary step after a system wide update where processing of jobs was stoped before.
An administrator wants to update information about scheduler status

post.description: An administrator or the current project owner changes the ownership of an existing SecHub project. The old owner will still be assigned to the project, but can be removed later by the owner if necessary.

parameters.description: The wanted page number. When not defined, the default will be 0.

parameters.name: metadata.labels.*
parameters.description:
An optional dynamic query parameter to filter jobs by labels. The syntax is 'metadata.labels.${labelKey}=${labelValue}'.

It is possible to query for multiple labels (up to 10 ).
The filter works as an AND combination: Only jobs having all wanted label key value combinations are returned.

parameters.name: withMetaData
parameters.description: An optional parameter to define if meta data shall be fetched as well. When not defined, the default will be false.
